item.title: The Philippines' economic outlook has improved according to the World Bank
item.description: The World Bank has improved its economic forecast for the Philippines from 2016 to 2018. They now predict the Philippine economy will grow by 6.8% in 2016, up from their previous prediction of 6.4% made in October (World Bank Philippines Economic Update October 2016). This adjustment is based on stronger than expected growth in the third quarter of 2016, fueled by increased investment and private consumption. This follows robust economic performance in the first half of 2016, driven by the governmentâ€™s pre-election spending.
